creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings:
Collector stamp in graphite, verso center: P. Mariette II (Lugt 1789)

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso center: Soliman Lieutaud (Lugt 1682)

Collector stamp in brown ink, verso lower center: Soliman Lieutaud (Lugt 2360)

Inscribed in graphite, verso: Pierre Van Fozxest
inscribed:
Inscribed and dated in plate, upper center: AETAT SUAE 64. Ao 1586

Signed in plate, lower right corner: HG.

Six lines in Latin and initials in margin below plate, lower center: Ceu viuum ut videas, ... in ære tibi. / N.F.A.

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Pierre II Mariette [1634-1716, Lugt 1789]. Soliman Lieutaud [ca. 1810, Lugt 1682]. Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
